snippet: The atmosphere was great, and everything we had - the curry, naan, and lassi - was absolutely delicious. Above all, the staff was incredibly friendly, which made the whole dining experience even better. I'll definitely be coming back!

snippet: Fantastic fusion food!!  Honestly the best Indian Asian food I have had traveling the World.  Service is okay.  Not knocking it because we may have gone there during a severe off season (late July in Georgetown).  If you are traveling, must stop here.  Small, quaint, and the food again is beautifully crafted and delicious!

snippet:
Very impressed! Great classic Indian fusion and Nepalese. They even have pizza with a Indian twist. It's an informal sit down, where they take your order at your table, but you get your own water, and then pack the food you didn't finish at the end.

The pizza was excellent as was the butter chicken. They can make it spicy too.

snippet: Overall, this place was pretty good. We had originally wanted to go to yellow, but the line was too long. The restaurant itself is a little awkward because the dining area is on the second floor and it‚Äôs a little cramped. The bathroom was a little bit small and did not have air conditioning. We ordered the tikka masala pizza, and the butter chicken, which were decent, but probably not the best Indian food I‚Äôve had. The chicken was a little dry and overcooked.

snippet:
The idea of this place is great, but the Chicken Tikka Masala pizza could have been better. By no means was it bad, but it certainly had room to improve.

The big drawback was the ambiance. The moment my party entered, the entire restaurant smelled like urine, as if the bathroom on the first floor had been backed up and not cleaned, so that immediately put a damper on our appetites. The service was prompt, polite, and attentive, so full stars on that.

I'm glad we tried this place, but I'm not sure we would come back, honestly.

snippet: Everything here feels cozy and comfortable. Cozy for its clean (Hygge vibes) and cool (as in strong a/c); and comfortable for its comforting tikka masala, tandoori and biryani. Portions are big so the food is not only tasty but good value for money as well. This is one those restos you like coming back to again and again when you feel like great Indian food with rice or Indian-inspired pizza (like the delicious addicting chicken tikka masala pizza).

snippet:
From the moment we walked in, Curry &‚ÄØPie set the tone for a genuinely memorable meal. The food? Absolutely‚ÄØdelicious. We tried a few things rich, aromatic curries bursting with flavor, fresh‚Äëbaked naan that was warm and fluffy, and even their fusion pizzas (yes, it works!) which were surprisingly fantastic. The spice levels were well‚Äëbalanced and you could tell everything was made with care.

The staff were wonderful. Friendly, attentive, and genuinely happy to help us choose and make sure we had a great experience. Their service added that extra layer to the meal that turned ‚Äúgood‚Äù into ‚Äúgreat.‚Äù

We will definitely be returning. Whether it‚Äôs a casual lunch, a late‚Äënight bite, or a fun dinner with friends, this place ticks all the boxes excellent food, welcoming staff, and a vibe that feels relaxed yet special.

If you‚Äôre in Georgetown and looking for a place where the food hits and the service matches, Curry &‚ÄØPie is a winner. Don‚Äôt hesitate.

details.parking_options: Paid parking lot, Free of charge street parking

snippet: The restaurant is a tiny one. It's cute though. There are 2 levels, both spaces are small. When we first got there we waited for a little bit but no one came so we rang the bell and someone directed us upstairs. We ordered the chicken tikka masala, naan bread (which we never got), and chicken biryani. The portions were small for the very expensive prices (but we were in DC so this might be normal there?) and the food didn't taste as good as we had hoped. I guess they're known for their pizzas, which we didn't get. The service was also very slow. We had dinner there on a weekday.

snippet:

I had an amazing dinner last evening! I tried the Chicken Tikka Pizza and Saag Paneer Pizza ‚Äî both were delicious! The flavors were authentic, and so satisfying. You can really taste the quality and creativity in each bite.

The ambience was good and staff were respectful and friendly, making the whole experience even better.

Highly recommend this place if you're looking for great food with a fusion. I‚Äôll definitely be coming back soon!

snippet:
Tldr: food was very good but the place itself wasn‚Äôt that nice
I dont feel like pouring my heart out rn, so this review is gonna be short. I was craving some indian food so i went down to this place because all the other Indian places in Georgetown seemed sketchy. First glance, the interior isnt too fancy, its a very simple place, and pretty small at that. But its not like it was too run down. A waitress came up to us and we ordered a chicken tikki masala and the mango fizz drink. It was delicious! The masala wasn‚Äôt too spicy but it was full of flavor. Usually i dont like carbonated or sweet drinks but the mango fizz wasnt too bubbly and it was naturally sweet. Also the food was brought to us in plastic containers even though we were dining in. They said that they were going through some renovations and that they would remove some of the less popular items from the menu and add asian cuisine, so keep that in mind.

snippet: Everything was sooo incredible. We stopped in on their soft reopening and had an amazing meal. The pork wontons & dipping sauce, saag paneer pizza, and chicken makhani curry were SO delicious. Piping hot, good portions, and incredible flavors. We ate everything! And not to mention their mango lassi was the BEST we have ever had. Pricing is not even bad for what is in the area. 10/10 recommend

snippet: The food is always amazing. My biggest complaint is on their delivery orders. I waited 2 hours to get my food and the didn‚Äôt even include the sauces that come along with the orders. Would definitely recommend eating in than ordering takeout or delivery.

snippet: My husband and I went cycling on the C&O Canal Trail and he forgot the snacks.  So I was famished from our ride when we returned to Georgetown. I went into Curry N Pie for the first time to see what they had and discovered their DELICIOUS mango lassi smoothies which were ready for take-out.  That was the perfect refreshment to get me the rest of the way home!  The rest of the menu looked good, so we'll definitely be back to try more.

snippet: Friendly workers and great food! I needed a receipt after the fact and they were so accommodating with finding a way to send it to me. I have ordered from them multiple times and the food has been consistently great!

extracted_snippet.original: Friendly workers and great food! I needed a receipt after the fact and they were so accommodating with finding a way to send it to me. I have ordered from them multiple times and the food has been consistently great!

snippet: It's a pretty busy place and there are only two people working the front, so it might take some time for them to get to you. The seats are on the second floor, our elder company needed some assistance getting up there. But the food is definitely worth the hassle. It took some time, but that means everything is prepared fresh and dont taste the same. Paneer saag(mild) has a lightly sweet milky aroma, and lamb saag(medium) was nice and savory. Aloo gobhi has a pleasant tanginess from the tomato. I would love to visit this place again and try more dishes.

snippet:
We were on campus at Georgetown University and looking for a place to have lunch and saw this restaurant on Yelp.  We were not disappointed!  The restaurant is pretty small but it really delivers.  Most of the tables are up on the second floor but there are a couple of tables on the first floor when you walk in.  The service was prompt and the food was amazing!  We did a plate of the Chicken Momos (think an Indian version of potstickers), the Paneer Makhani (the sauce was TO DIE FOR!), and a piece of naan.  The naan was the only thing we felt luke warm about - not that it was bad just that everything else was so good!

Although we didn‚Äôt try it, we saw a few tables order the French Fry Chaat and it looked great!

I hope you decide to try this place - you won‚Äôt be disappointed!

snippet: I always recommend the Chicken Tikka Masala Pizza. I tell all my friends and family that it‚Äôs better than Pizza Hut from the 90s. The taste, the consistency, the fresh ingredients make this the perfect pizza. Enjoy

snippet: This place is definitely a hidden gem. The Chaat fries were something I've never tasted before and highly recommend! The food was incredible and the portions were huge! I probably could eat here every day if it weren't 2+ hours away. And it's right across the street from the exorcist steps so you can hit a quick tourist spot right after!

snippet:
Based on high reviews and praise from reddit and google, my fiancee and I decided to give this place a try. We ordered our food through the online website through Curry & Pie assuming that it would be directly with the website to help the restaurant avoid potential fees with uber eats and other food services.

We placed our order at 6:30 PM and based on the email confirmation from the store, the food was supposed to be ready by 7:04. We arrived to the store at 7:15 giving more than enough time but was told the food was not ready and would be 10 minutes later. I am now sitting in the restaurant waiting on my food for additional 30 minutes and the staff have been avoiding me.

The first round of food came out but was incomplete. I was told 2 minutes and it took an additional 20 minutes. My order was incomplete and the food is now sitting cold while i wait on my complete order. The staff have made no attempt to rectify the situation and are avoiding others who have ordered online as well. Do not order food from here if you plan on doing a carry out. It seems that dine in experience may be better but with staff on their phone or just avoid customers, not sure how attentive customer service is for dine in customers.

Edit: after getting home to check the final portions/bag of my order, the food was inaccurate and got someone else‚Äôs order. On top of that, all the food was cold which is partially due to the 1 hr additional wait for food and it seems that some of the food (pizza) was never fully up to temperature. The pizza is stodgy like a frozen pizza and seems to be made in a rush. The garlic naan I ordered is pretty doughy and seems to be under cooked/baked. The pakora in the corner was deep fried beyond recognition and just taste of oil.

extracted_snippet.original:

snippet:
Convenient location for walking to when visiting in Georgetown. Parking is tough in the area.

The upstairs dining area is pleasant and a good place for small groups. There is no way for people with physical disabilities to enter the restaurant or dining area.

Pleasant staff serving tasty food.  Indian style pizzas are a great idea. Reasonable prices.

snippet: I adore Indian food, so it's great that there is such a superb Indian restaurant in the Georgetown neighborhood. Curry and Pie is small, but that doesn't infringe on its service or deliciousness. Everything on their menu is scrumptious, whether it is a curry or fusion dish. Their curries tend to be on the sweeter side of things, but you can request varying degrees of spice to diversify the taste. Pictured below are the Malai Kofta and French Fry Chaat dishes they serve, which I would recommend. Hope you enjoy eating here as much as I have.

snippet:
Loved it here. We were supposed to order our food and pay for it then take seat. The lady at counter brings the food to our table when it's ready.

Me and my wife went there around 5 pm on a Sunday. We sat upstairs where there were seating. It was moderately crowded. Food were so delicious and it was good quantity as well. We ordered a curry pie of chicken Tikka masala curry. And a French fry chaat. The French fry chaat reminded me of Poutine I had in Vancouver, Canada.

snippet: The unassuming front and stairs takes you into a cozy waiting area; the main dining floor is upstairs. There are well-chosen decorations and lighting that make the atmosphere feel relaxing and quaint. The food is extremely solid-heavily spiced, filling, and warm. The mutter paneer is creamy, with a satisfying tomato background. It comes with rice, but the naan is good enough to order as well. Their lassi is, well, lassi ‚Äì it won‚Äôt disappoint. The place seems to be pretty popular as well, so you may want to call ahead and make a reservation.

‚Ä¢ Chicken Tikka Masala with Basmati Rice
‚Ä¢ Garlic Naan
‚Ä¢ Lamb Vindaloo Curry Pizza Pie
‚Ä¢ Milk tea

snippet:
Menu Inaccuracy & Severe Allergic Reaction

This restaurant is one of my favorite restaurants in the DC area, and I was extremely disappointed by my experience after its renovation when I visited with my partner for his birthday. I've been here many times, always ordering the Chicken Tikka Masala pizza because it's truly one of the best pizzas I've ever had. This was not the case when we visited after their recent renovation. The restaurant has taken a new turn with Korean food on the menu and a cafeteria style atmosphere where you get your utensils, water, and everything. This is absolutely not an issue as they still had my favorite pizza on the menu. The options on the menu for pizza flavors were: Chicken Tikka Masala, Saag Paneer, and Margarita.

I ordered and paid for the pizza up front at the register before sitting down upstairs. The food came quickly but the pizza was entirely different from our usual Chicken Tikka Masala. Without informing anyone of this change, the kitchen served a pizza that had a completely different look and taste (including bell peppers, onions). This was after our experience, but I have since checked other reviews and with friends who ate at the restaurant and ordered the same pizza when they went. The pizza we were served was actually the Chicken Tikka pizza and not the Chicken Tikka Masala pizza. The restaurant has decided to replace the Chicken Tikka Masala pizza with the Chicken Tikka pizza, without telling anyone.

In any case, we ate the pizza because we wanted to give it a try. Unfortunately, the pizza definitely has a very different set of ingredients from the Chicken Tikka Masala pizza as we both suffered severe allergic reactions to (most likely) nuts in the pizza. My issue with the restaurant is two-fold here: why serve a Chicken Tikka pizza if the menu says Chicken Tikka Masala and why is there no allergy warning for the pizza?

I understand that there is an allergy warning up front at the cash register, but it's clear to me that this warning serves as a catch-all rather than being anything helpful for the restaurant patrons. It would've been helpful if the restaurant marked that there would be nuts in a pizza that 1) is not the correct pizza and 2) definitely has nuts.

Again, this is one of our favorite places to eat in DC and we were really disappointed by our experience, especially for a birthday. Due to the severe allergic reactions, we were unable to keep the food down and couldn't eat for the rest of the night as well.

Again, this is one of our favorite places to eat in DC and we were really disappointed by our experience, especially for a birthday. Due to the severe allergic reactions, we were unable to keep the food down and couldn't eat for the rest of the night as well.

response.snippet:
Thank you for your feedback. We sincerely apologize that your experience at Curry N Pie did not meet your expectations. Your satisfaction is very important to us, and we regret any disappointment caused.

We also want to reassure you that we take food allergies very seriously. Please rest assured that we do not use any nuts in our kitchen, and we strive to accommodate all dietary concerns to ensure a safe and enjoyable dining experience.

Additionally, we‚Äôre excited to share that our original chef will be returning tomorrow, bringing back the beloved recipes that our guests know and love! We would truly appreciate the opportunity to welcome you back and provide the experience you deserve.

As a gesture of our appreciation, I would love to personally take care of your next meal‚Äîon us! Please give us a call at the restaurant at your convenience, and we‚Äôll make sure your next visit is a great one.

Thank you,
Maddie Jo

snippet:
As someone who is half Italian and half Indian (Curry & Pie's specialities), I was intrigued to try this place. At first, my friend and I were not exactly sure if saag paneer would fuse well with a pizza. We changed our minds once we saw the pictures online. The restaurant is in a great location near the Georgetown campus, and is one of the only Indian restaurants in the area.

We were very impressed with the food tonight. The saag paneer pizza was amazing! I could easily taste the Italian and the Indian influences in the dish. More importantly, I tasted each cuisine fused together as one meal. I've had Indian food in the United States, India, and in Egypt, as well as Italian food in the United States and in Italy. I can safely say that the saag paneer pizza I had tonight ranks up there with the top Indian and Italian food I have ever head. For ten bucks, you can not only get Washington DC's top cuisine, but the dish will also fill you up really well.

In addition, we also ordered a Malai Kofta. The malai kofta was very delicious as well, and it is cheaper than the other Indian restaurants nearby (almost all of which have lower ratings than Curry & Pie).

Amazing food overall as well as an excellent ambiance. Curry & Pie fills the culinary needs of groups with both food lovers and picky eaters (and groups with Italian-Indian people). I cannot wait to come back to Washington DC and eat at Curry & Pie again.
